sen.j: 元老院（げんろういん）は、明治初期の日本の立法機関。
sen.e: Genroin was a legislative organ in the early Meiji era in Japan.
Genroin was a legislative organ in the early Meiji era in Japan.
Genroin was a legislative organ in the early Meiji era in Japan.

sen.j: 新法の制定と旧法の改定を行うこととしたが、議案は天皇の命令として正院（後に内閣）から下付され、緊急を要する場合は事後承認するだけになるなど権限は弱かった。
sen.e: It established a new law and revised an old law, but a Bill was given down to the Central State Council (later Cabinet) as the order of the Emperor, and in the case of emergency it approved after the case, so that it did not have powerful authority.

It established a new law and revised an old law, but a Bill was given down to the Central State Council (later Cabinet) as the order of the Emperor, and in the case of emergency it approved after the case, so that it did not have powerful authority.

It established a new law and revised an old law, but a Bill was given down to the Central State Council (later Cabinet) as the order of the Emperor, and in the case of emergency it approved after the case, so that it did not have powerful authority.

sen.j: 構成者は元老院議官と称した。
sen.e: The members of construction were called councilor of the senate.
The members of construction were called councilor of the senate.
The members of construction were called councilor of the senate.

sen.j: 1875年に大久保利通・伊藤博文・木戸孝允・板垣退助らの大阪会議での合意に基づき、続いて出された立憲政体の詔書によって1875年4月25日左院にかわり設置された。
sen.e: Genroin was established succeeded from the Left State Council (an organ which report a legislative decision to the Central State Council) in April 25, 1875, by the agreement at the Osaka conference in 1875 among Toshimichi OKUBO, Hirobumi ITO, Takayoshi KIDO, and Taisuke ITAGAKI, and the document of the Emperor of the constitutional system given later.

Genroin was established succeeded from the Left State Council (an organ which report a legislative decision to the Central State Council) on April 25, 1875, by the agreement at the Osaka conference in 1875 among Toshimichi OKUBO, Hirobumi ITO, Takayoshi KIDO, and Taisuke ITAGAKI, and the document of the Emperor of the constitutional system given later.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞をonに訂正しました。
sen.e: Genroin was established succeeded from the Left State Council (an organ which report a legislative decision to the Central State Council) on April 25, 1875, by the agreement at the Osaka conference in 1875 among Toshimichi OKUBO, Hirobumi ITO, Takayoshi KIDO, and Taisuke ITAGAKI, and the document of the Emperor of the constitutional system given later.

sen.j: 当初は正副議長各1名が置かれ定員は無制限とされたが、程なく財政上の都合から同年11月25日に職制が改正されて正副議長各1名とこれを補佐する幹事2名（1886年廃止）、その他の議官28名の計32名が定数とされた。
sen.e: At first, it was constituted of a President and a Vice-president, and quota was unlimited, but soon after according to the financial matter the office organization was revised on November 25 in the same year (in 1875), the member was a President, a Vice-president, two secretaries who support them, (abolished in 1886), and other 28 bureaucrats, in total 32 members were admitted as the quota.

At first, it was constituted of a President and a Vice-president, and quota was unlimited, but soon after according to the financial matter the office organization was revised on November 25 in the same year (in 1875), the member was a President, a Vice-president, two secretaries who support them, (abolished in 1886), and other 28 bureaucrats, in total 32 members were admitted as the quota.

At first, it was constituted of a President and a Vice-president, and quota was unlimited, but soon after according to the financial matter the office organization was revised on November 25 in the same year (in 1875), the member was a President, a Vice-president, two secretaries who support them, (abolished in 1886), and other 28 bureaucrats, in total 32 members were admitted as the quota.

sen.j: 議長は左大臣の兼務とされたが実際には一度もその事例は無く、設置当初は議長は空席で副議長の後藤象二郎が議長の職務を代行した。
sen.e: The President was appointed to the additional post of Sadaijin (Minister of the left), but no cases were recorded, when Genroin was established the Presidential seat was vacant and the Vice-president Shojiro GOTO acted for the President.

The President was appointed to the additional post of Sadaijin (Minister of the left), but no cases were recorded, when Genroin was established the Presidential seat was vacant and the Vice-president Shojiro GOTO acted for the President.

The President was appointed to the additional post of Sadaijin (Minister of the left), but no cases were recorded, when Genroin was established the Presidential seat was vacant and the Vice-president Shojiro GOTO acted for the President.

sen.j: 1875年11月の改正に伴い、これを補佐するために幹事が新設されて陸奥宗光・河野敏鎌が幹事となった。
sen.e: Due to the revision in November 1875, a post of secretary was newly established to support the President, Munemitsu MUTSU and Togama KONO were appointed to the secretary.
Due to the revision in November 1875, a post of secretary was newly established to support the President, Munemitsu MUTSU and Togama KONO were appointed to the secretary.
Due to the revision in November 1875, a post of secretary was newly established to support the President, Munemitsu MUTSU and Togama KONO were appointed to the secretary.

sen.j: 熾仁親王が議長に就任すると、岩倉具視の要請で1876年9月8日に国憲（憲法）草案起草の勅命が元老院に対して出された。
sen.e: When Prince Taruhito was appointed to the President, an imperial order of drawing up a draft constitution was given to Genroin by the request of Tomomi IWAKURA in September 8, 1876.
When Prince Taruhito was appointed to the President, an imperial order of drawing up a draft constitution was given to Genroin by the request of Tomomi IWAKURA on September 8, 1876.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞をonに訂正しました。
sen.e: When Prince Taruhito was appointed to the President, an imperial order of drawing up a draft constitution was given to Genroin by the request of Tomomi IWAKURA on September 8, 1876.

sen.j: これに基づいて2度の「国憲草案」（1876年10月及び1878年10月）が作成されたが、正院側からは酷評されて採用されなかった。
sen.e: Based on this, 'draft constitution' was made twice (in October 1876 and in October 1878), but it was not adopted, because the Central State Council savaged it.
Based on this, 'draft constitution' was made twice (in October 1876 and in October 1878), but it was not adopted, because the Central State Council savaged it.
Based on this, 'draft constitution' was made twice (in October 1876 and in October 1878), but it was not adopted, because the Central State Council savaged it.

sen.j: また、このころの元老院の議論は低調で1878年1月20日付の「輿論雑誌」には、元老院でまともに議論をしているのは両幹事（陸奥・河野）と中島信行・細川潤次郎の4名だけと揶揄されている。
sen.e: The discussion at Genroin those days was inactive, so it was teased on 'Public Opinion Magazine' that the members who were discussing sincerely were just 4 members who were two secretaries (MUTSU, KONO), Nobuyuki NAKAJIMA and Junjiro HOSOKAWA.

The discussion at Genroin those days was inactive, so it was teased on 'Public Opinion Magazine' issued on January 20, 1878 that the members who were discussing sincerely were just 4 members who were two secretaries (MUTSU, KONO), Nobuyuki NAKAJIMA and Junjiro HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: issued on January, 1878を挿入しました。
sen.e: The discussion at Genroin those days was inactive, so it was teased on 'Public Opinion Magazine' issued on January 20, 1878 that the members who were discussing sincerely were just 4 members who were two secretaries (MUTSU, KONO), Nobuyuki NAKAJIMA and Junjiro HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: しかも追い討ちをかけるように6月には幹事の陸奥宗光が立志社の獄の容疑者とされて元老院を追放されたのを機に、正院側から元老院の権力を抑制しようとする動きが現れ、以後正院の干渉を受けるようになった。
sen.e: Furthermore, as one misfortune followed another, Secretary Munemitsu MUTSU was forced to be a suspect of Risshisha no goku incident in June, and expelled from Genroin, so that on this occasion a side of the Central State Council moved to control the authority of Genroin, then it had to be interfered by the Central State Council later on.

Furthermore, as one misfortune followed another, Secretary Munemitsu MUTSU was forced to be a suspect of Risshisha no goku incident in June, and expelled from Genroin, so that on this occasion a side of the Central State Council moved to control the authority of Genroin, then it had to be interfered by the Central State Council later on.

Furthermore, as one misfortune followed another, Secretary Munemitsu MUTSU was forced to be a suspect of Risshisha no goku incident in June, and expelled from Genroin, so that on this occasion a side of the Central State Council moved to control the authority of Genroin, then it had to be interfered by the Central State Council later on.

sen.j: 1880年以後、定数は事実上無視されて知事や政府高官経験者が次の役職を得るまでの待機ポストの色合いを強める。
sen.e: After the year of 1880 the quota was ignored practically, it became a kind of waiting post for a prefectural governor and high officials of the government by getting a new post.
After the year of 1880 the quota was ignored practically, it became a kind of waiting post for a prefectural governor and high officials of the government by getting a new post.
After the year of 1880 the quota was ignored practically, it became a kind of waiting post for a prefectural governor and high officials of the government by getting a new post.

sen.j: 廃止時には定員が91名にまで増員され、その多くが元老院廃止後にそのまま貴族院議員に転身する。
sen.e: When it was abolished the quota was increased to 91, the most of them transferred to the House of Noble after the abolition of Genroin.
When it was abolished the quota was increased to 91, the most of them transferred to the House of Noble after the abolition of Genroin.
When it was abolished the quota was increased to 91, the most of them transferred to the House of Noble after the abolition of Genroin.

sen.j: 1890年10月30日、帝国議会開設のため廃止された。
sen.e: Genroin was abolished in October 30, 1890, for the establishment of the Imperial Diet.
Genroin was abolished on October 30, 1890, for the establishment of the Imperial Diet.
sen.cmt: 日付の前置詞をonに訂正しました。
sen.e: Genroin was abolished on October 30, 1890, for the establishment of the Imperial Diet.

sen.j: 有栖川宮熾仁親王1876年5月－1880年2月
